headline: Morgan Stanley sets jaw-dropping Micron price target after event
summary: When parallels are drawn between a company and Nvidia, investors pay attention. That’s exactly how Morgan Stanley framed Micron Technology’s (MU) latest quarter, calling it one of the biggest revenue and profit surprises in the history of the U.S. chip space, second only to Nvidia’s AI-powered ...

headline: Why Axon (AXON) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of self defense company AXON (NASDAQ:AXON) jumped 2.8% in the afternoon session after investor optimism was buoyed by a strong consensus among Wall Street analysts.

headline: Morgan Stanley Investment Management ETF Platform Surpasses $10 Billion
summary: NEW YORK, December 18, 2025--Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM) today announced its exchange-traded fund (ETF) platform surpassed $10 billion in assets under management. This milestone reflects strong investor appetite for MSIM’s active and systematic ETFs that can potentially help investors meet their goals while leveraging MSIM’s global investment capabilities.

raw.headline: Morgan Stanley Investment Management ETF Platform Surpasses $10 Billion
raw.summary: NEW YORK, December 18, 2025--Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM) today announced its exchange-traded fund (ETF) platform surpassed $10 billion in assets under management. This milestone reflects strong investor appetite for MSIM’s active and systematic ETFs that can potentially help investors meet their goals while leveraging MSIM’s global investment capabilities.

headline: 3 Stocks to Buy From the Prospering Investment Banking Industry
summary: Efforts to boost operating efficiency, strong trading performance and momentum in underwriting and advisory businesses will support Zacks Investment Bank industry players, like Morgan Stanley (MS), Robinhood (HOOD) and Piper Sandler (PIPR).

headline: Morgan Stanley recommends adding to this major chip stock ahead of 2026
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley told investors in a note Thursday that it recommends increasing positions in one key semiconductor stock ahead of 2026, raising its price target and reiterating the stock as a top pick, citing accelerating AI-driven growth and expanding margins.

headline: OUTFRONT Media (OUT): Reassessing Valuation After Analyst Upgrades and Renewed Optimism on Ad Demand
summary: Morgan Stanley’s upgrade and a wave of upbeat commentary from other banks have put OUTFRONT Media (OUT) back on investors’ radar, as expectations build around improving ad demand and leaner operations. See our latest analysis for OUTFRONT Media. The upbeat calls from Morgan Stanley and others seem to have lit a fire under the stock, with a roughly 31% 3 month share price return and a 45% one year total shareholder return signaling that momentum is building around OUTFRONT’s recovery story. If...

headline: Carla Harris on the Board's Most Crucial Task: CEO Succession
summary: Inside the Boardroom: Carla Harris, a board member at Walmart, Cummins, and MetLife and Senior Client Advisor at Morgan Stanley, joins WSJ's Emily Glazer to analyze the critical role of CEO succession planning in the modern boardroom. Recorded on Nov. 10, 2025.

headline: Bank of England cuts interest rates, in welcome Christmas boost for consumers
summary: The Bank of England voted to cut interest rates from 4% to 3.75% in its last monetary policy move of 2025.

headline: Meta Platforms, Inc. (META) Boasts Significant Upside Potential Despite Morgan Stanley Price Target Cut
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META) is one of billionaire David Tepper’s top stock picks heading into 2026. On December 11, Morgan Stanley cut its price target of Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META) to $750 from $820 while reiterating an Overweight rating. The price cut comes amid concerns that sentiments around the social media networking stock have turned […]

headline: Looking at the Narrative for GE HealthCare as Margin Execution and Tech Upside Reshape Expectations
summary: GE HealthCare Technologies stock has seen only a marginal uptick in its fair value estimate to about $89.22 per share, even as the assumed discount rate has eased from roughly 8.40% to around 8.30%. This shift reflects growing confidence in mid term execution rather than a wholesale re rating. At the same time, slightly softer long term revenue growth assumptions near 4.26% suggest analysts are balancing that optimism with caution around macro and market specific risks. As these small but...
